data.title: "Convert All" menu option for things like moving projects to Godot 2.0
data.body:
Right now, I notice that when opening Godot 2.0 alpha, you have to save each scene instance individually to convert them to the new binary format (or otherwise using the new refactoring tools removes access to scene files among other things).

It would be nice to just have a _convert all_ button for this case. Yes, it would take longer, but it would ensure there are no cases where something messes up due to binary versions being different from file to file (which would also apply to future upgrades beyond Godot 2.0).

I would also note, due to potentially long conversion times, you might want to give it a 'confirm' dialogue just in case it was accidentally clicked (or just disable it if the program cannot find any older binary versions within the files).

Thoughts?

data.title: Shader vec2 parameter behaving as float in UI
data.body:
I have a shader that has several vec2 parameters however 2 of them show as vec2 in the CanvasItemMaterial parameter UI but only accept a single value (left/right limit).  Note the type icon is for a vector but only a single value is editable.  These two started life as float parameters and it seems the change to being vec2 confused something.  Exiting and restarting godot did not fix it.  Running 1.1Stable on Windows 7 64 bit.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/10090079/057e9abc-62f9-11e5-93c7-fdb8dd914f65.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/10090082/0f3e7112-62f9-11e5-9797-6afb91d9b951.png)

They appeared like this in the scene XML:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/10090134/99cd475e-62f9-11e5-8f75-d0b2ffd61aba.png)

After manually editing the XML and reopening the scene, they show correctly and are editable:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/10090141/b494bc0c-62f9-11e5-9f35-04b7eef6519e.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/10090146/bd5464aa-62f9-11e5-80c8-5c062bae089d.png)

data.title: JSON parsing fails on escape sequences that need no escape
data.body:
JSON parse will fail when it encounters an escape sequence that's not defined. The problem seems to be here: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/master/core/io/json.cpp#L223 . Even though this means the JSON is invalid, I think the parser should be a bit more forgiving :smile: 

E.g. it will fail on input such as

``` json
{
   "test": "Some string with a bad escape \- See\? It fails for both the dash and question mark..."
}
```

data.title: Add missing \n to world_wrap.
data.body:
The issue was that world_wrap would skip over newlines, without adding them to the output.

Closes #2516.

data.title: Script editor auto-completion for function parameters
data.body:
The script editor completes variable names, but not function parameters. It'd nice to have that too.

---

Say I have a code like this:

``` GDScript
func my_func(parameter):
    var variable
```

With the current behavior, if I start typing `varia` it'll suggest `variable` as it was previously defined. If I start typing `param` it won't suggest `parameter`.

My proposition is that `parameter` should also be suggested for autocompletion.

data.title: Enhancement suggestions for the filesystem dock
data.body:
That topic is of course "IMO".

When opening a Godot project in current master, the filesystem dock looks like that:
![fs1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/10059235/25382ab2-624a-11e5-9bbf-c3419d997478.jpg)
I do believe that not so long ago, it used to also show files and not only folders. One could expand folders in the tree to access files directly with single clicks.

Now one can only double click to open folder, and then get:
![fs2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/10059267/4f1355e6-624a-11e5-8cf4-71eb42d3ee79.jpg)
Here the interface changes completely, even the buttons at the top are different. With a bit of tweaking one can find that the tree icon on the left brings back to the first screenshot, and there again there is no obvious way to switch back to the non-tree view apart from opening a folder.

Then by clicking the "list" icon one can get the listing without preview, which is better IMO for projects with many files (that's of course subjective, so it's nice to have both possibilities).
![fs3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/10059306/845c194a-624a-11e5-88f8-c07fae1a87d3.jpg)

So I see actually two "problems":
- Files missing from the tree is IMO a regression. Browsing the filesystem via the tree view is the most effective in my workflow.
- The fact that UI buttons differ in the tree view and in the other views is a bit confusing IMO. It would probably be better to have the same icons, and be able to switch between all three layouts using three icons.

data.title: Tooltip help shows badly parsed newlines
data.body:
The tooltip help for the Y sort function recently documented is as shown here:
![contextual-help](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/10059062/0bf270cc-6249-11e5-9623-fa3fe5ba119d.jpg)

The corresponding description is however:

```
        <method name="set_y_sort_mode">
            <argument index="0" name="enable" type="bool">
            </argument>
            <description>
            Set the Y sort mode. Enabled Y sort mode means that children of the tilemap will be drawn in the order defined by their Y coordinate.
            A tile with a higher Y coordinate will therefore be drawn later, potentially covering up the tile(s) above it if its sprite is higher than its cell size.
            </description>
        </method>
```

(with tabs instead of spaces)

So there is a newline before "A tile with a higher...", but it's somehow last when parsing the XML data to generate the tooltip.

data.title: In-editor help formatting (padding)
data.body:
In the reference help in the editor, there is a lot more padding added after a function header than before. There is therefore a big gap before the function's header and its description, while there is only a small gap between function N's description and function N+1's header, which is somewhat confusing.

![help-padding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/10058984/8f2b2098-6248-11e5-8d98-951be3784552.jpg)

data.title: Document TileMap class
TileMap {g,s}et_center_{x,y} unused?
data.body:
The TileMap class has setters and getters for `center_x` and `center_y` members variables, that according to the documentation should: "Set tiles to be centered in x coordinate. (by default this is false and they are drawn from upper left cell corner)."

However there seems to be no usage of these member variables in TileMap, nor (as far as I could see) in its children. If so, they could probably be dropped?

data.title: Flip < and > in String::xml_escape.
data.body:
Before > referred to `<` and < to `>`, which is incorrect...
Closes #2511

data.title: Doctool flips >/< at each run
data.body:
In doc/base/classes.xml, we have a string with a ">" symbol, XML escaped as >:

```
Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog->add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");
```

However, each time `godot -doctool doc/base/classes.xml`, it flips the sign and replaces > by <, or < by >, so we get:

```
diff --git a/doc/base/classes.xml b/doc/base/classes.xml
index 74cacb0..7a5e908 100644
--- a/doc/base/classes.xml
+++ b/doc/base/classes.xml
@@ -10346,7 +10346,7 @@
                        <argument index="0" name="filter" type="String">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
-                       Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog->add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");
+                       Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog-<add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");
                        </description>
                </method>
                <method name="get_current_dir" qualifiers="const">
```

When executing doctool again, the "flip" is reverted.

data.title: Fix a bug with doctool
data.body:
Doctool was inserting `"  >"` after every method open tag. e.g. it generated methods like:

``` xml
<method name="name"  >
  <!--
    Notice the two spaces after the second quote of "name"
  -->
</method>
```

Please test, this was made from GitHub GUI, so couldn't test it myself.

data.title: Scroll wheel does not scroll UI controls if the mouse cursor is near the bottom of these controls.
data.body:
I'm having that issue with Windows 8 64 bits, Godot Engine v1.1.stable.d3b42e41b0.  This happens both in game and in the editor, which is reassuring.

Scrollable areas do not react to the scroll wheel when the cursor is within 30ish pixels of the bottom of these areas.  Left or right clicks work (tested with TextEdit, Trees and all) but scrolling does not.  I circled these strange regions in red on the following screenshot.

![godot_scroll_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1502/9982890/6fcd3330-5feb-11e5-8df0-c3b9cc56e2e2.png)
